docs.text: all through its production and into the early days of its initial , aborted pre-release publicity , hard rain bore the appropriate moniker of the flood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ultimately , however , paramount pictures , nervous that this movie would be confused with 1996's other , underperforming disaster films ( dante's peak , volcano ) , changed the title and shifted the release date by nearly a year .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , to paraphrase the bard , swill , by any other name , would smell as rank .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no number of name changes can help this picture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not just about a disaster , it is a disaster .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hard rain is the case of a movie that gets progressively worse with every passing minute .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the best shot occurs during the opening credits , as the camera pans over the streets and byways of huntingburg , indiana as the water level slowly rises .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the community , protected by an overworked dam , is being evacuated as the rain continues to pour relentlessly from the cloud-choked skies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: from that moment on , it's all downhill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: whatever initial entertainment value the film possesses has long since drained away by the halfway point .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it takes forever to get to the end credits -- this is one of the longest-seeming 95-minute motion pictures i have recently endured .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: basically , hard rain is one extended , dull chase sequence punctuated by occasional shoot-outs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a lot of water , broken glass , gunfire , and explosions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's all very routine and uninteresting because there aren't any real characters and the plot only occasionally makes sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film's conclusion is so preposterous that it's almost worth watching for the sheer masochistic enjoyment of seeing the monumentally idiotic way that the film makers decide to resolve the myriad subplots that are floating around .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: action films are supposed to become progressively more invigorating as they rush towards a conclusion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: graham yost , the writer of both speed and hard rain , surely understands that principle .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , neither he , nor cinematographer-turned-director mikael salomon ( a far off place ) , applies it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action in hard rain grows tedious through repetition .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we see the same kinds of things -- speedboat chases , flood damage , shoot-outs , etc . -- over and over again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie constantly recycles about twenty minutes worth of material to pad the running time out to an acceptable movie length .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the storyline gives us a number of paper-thin characters in contrived circumstances .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's tom ( christian slater ) , the one- dimensional action hero who works as a security guard driving an armored car full of cash .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he and his partner , charlie ( edward asner , tv's " lou grant " ) , get stuck on a street that's rapidly turning into a river .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a group of men , led by jimmy ( morgan freeman ) , arrive on the scene not as rescuers but as robbers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after charlie is killed in a shoot-out , tom hides the money , then runs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as he swims and boats his way through huntingburg's roads , he encounters some of the locals : karen ( minnie driver ) , a would-be love interest ; a bickering old couple ( richard dysart and betty white ) , who are on hand to provide comic relief ; and the easily-corrupted sheriff ( randy quaid ) , whose seeming helpfulness hides sinister ulterior motives .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there isn't any real acting in this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: christian slater utters a few lame one-liners and does a lot of mugging for the camera .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tom is easily one of the most lifeless characters the actor has brought to the screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: randy quaid sneers a lot , and is totally unconvincing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: morgan freeman and minnie driver both attempt to give legitimate performances , but they are defeated by the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: freeman , one of the best cinematic thespians working today , looks suitably embarrassed to be here , but i suppose everyone needs a good paycheck from time-to-time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: following in the wake of twister , this is yet another natural disaster movie that doesn't trust nature's fury as the chief engine of conflict .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a result , we are saddled with an idiotic good guys/bad guys story that effectively ruins any potential that the flood tale could have had .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: titanic proved that there can be a wealth of drama in a movie where everything goes under water .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hard rain successfully demonstrates that the opposite is equally possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: thus far this year , hollywood has already subjected us to its unique brand of moronic mayhem by fire ( firestorm ) and water ( hard rain ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fortunately , there are only two elements left .
docs.label: negative
